data.oai_dc:dc: North Temperate Lakes LTER: Light Extinction - Trout Lake Area

A light (PAR) extinction coefficient is calculated for the water column for the seven northern study lakes (Allequash, Big Muskellunge, Crystal, Sparkling, and Trout lakes, unnamed lakes 27-02 [Crystal Bog] and 12-15 [Trout Bog]). The fraction of surface light is computed at 0.25-m to 1-m depth intervals depending on the lake. The light (PAR) extinction coefficient is calculated by regressing ln(fraction of light(z)) on depth z.Sampling Frequency: fortnightly during ice-free season - every 6 weeks during ice-covered seasonNumber of sites: 7
North Temperate Lakes - LTER|light penetration|light extinction
